title: Federal Loan Simulator - Simulate Borrowing More - User Data
description: User data required to execute the Federal Student Aid Loan Simulator for borrowing more money for college. IMPORTANT: current_loans are the NEW loans you want to simulate borrowing, not existing loans. These represent the loan mix you want to borrow to cover the borrow_amount. For dependent undergrads, use a mix of Direct Subsidized, Direct Unsubsidized (up to annual limits), and Parent PLUS loans to cover remaining gap. For independent/graduate students, use Direct Graduate Unsubsidized and Grad PLUS loans. Look up current federal interest rates and annual borrowing limits to determine appropriate values.

program_timing.description: Whether borrowing for current or future program

program_type.description: Type of degree or program (e.g., Bachelor's degree, Master's degree)

dependency_status.description: Whether student is dependent (supported by parents) or independent

school_location.description: State where the school is located (optional, full state name like 'Illinois')

school_name.description: Name of the school or university (optional)

borrow_amount.description: Amount needed to pay for school (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 30000)

expected_salary.description: Expected yearly salary after completing program (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 55000)

income_growth_rate.description: Expected annual income growth rate as a percentage (e.g., 3 for 3%, default is 3)

current_loans.description: NEW loans to simulate borrowing (required: at least 1 loan). NOT existing loans - this is the loan mix you want to borrow to cover the borrow_amount. Must add up to approximately the borrow_amount. Use appropriate loan types based on student status (dependent/independent, undergrad/grad) and look up current federal interest rates.

loan_type.description: Type of student loan - MUST match FSA dropdown options exactly

loan_interest_rate.description: Interest rate as a percentage (e.g., 5.5 for 5.5%). Look up current federal student loan interest rates for accurate simulation. Typical ranges: Direct Loans 4-7%, PLUS Loans 7-9%, Private varies widely.

loan_balance.description: Loan amount to borrow (dollar amount without formatting, e.g., 10000). For federal loans, respect annual and aggregate borrowing limits. The sum of all loan_balance values should approximately equal borrow_amount.
